critique: This executive order focuses on regulatory flexibility, particularly concerning small businesses. It directs agencies to comply with the Regulatory Flexibility Act and consult with the Small Business Administration. There's no direct indication of a liberal or conservative ideological tilt. The order doesn't address immigration, so it's neutral on that front. It doesn't seem to expand executive power significantly; it mainly reinforces existing regulations. The order doesn't explicitly favor state or federal control, so it's neutral on federalism. It doesn't directly address national security or civil liberties, so it's neutral on that front. The order aims to reduce the regulatory burden on small businesses, suggesting a move towards deregulation. It doesn't directly address social inclusion, so it's neutral on that front.
